etymologies: early 20th century: probably from earlier shillaber, of unknown origin

definitions: an accomplice of a hawker, gambler, or swindler who acts as an enthusiastic customer to entice or encourage others

examples.text: I used to be a shill in a Reno gambling club
the agency is a shill for the nuclear power industry

shortDefinitions: accomplice of hawker, gambler, or swindler

definitions: a person who pretends to give an impartial endorsement of something in which they themselves have an interest

examples.text: a megamillionaire who makes more money as a shill for corporate products than he does for playing basketball

shortDefinitions: person who pretends to give impartial endorsement of something in which they have interest

definitions: act or work as a shill

examples.text: your husband in the crowd could shill for you

shortDefinitions: act or work as such person
